# Overview

A concept tech blogging platform I made in 2021, as part of learning Django under the HarvardX [CS50's Web Programming with JavaScript](https://www.edx.org/learn/web-development/harvard-university-cs50-s-web-programming-with-python-and-javascript) course.

# Description

The site offers a minimalistic interface for creating, discovering and interacting with blog posts. Users can change the visibility of their posts to be either public or private. Posts can be tagged with keywords for categorization.

A user has the ability to follow other users, whose posts will then be made available in their "Follower Feed" page.

Posts can be liked or marked as favorites, which then become available in dedicated "Liked Posts" or "Favorites" pages on the site. They can also contain comments and comment reply chains.

# Remarks

Looking back, there's lot of low-hanging friut in terms of UX, design decisions and security. Writing it all in pure CSS ended up working, but nowadays I would prefer to use [TailwindCSS](https://tailwindcss.com) for DX and productivity reasons.


{end-project}

---

This is an emerging early stage project in Python's pygame community space. We're building a new platform for [pygame(-ce)](https://pyga.me/) developers to showcase their creations. It can be considered as the spiritual successor to [pygame.org](https://www.pygame.org/).

# Details

[pygame.community](https://pygame.community) is meant to replace [our current landing page](https://github.com/pygame-community) on GitHub with a full fledged site. It will serve as the place to make announcements on community events (like our [game jams](https://itch.io/jams/hosted-by-pygame-community)), as well as any relevant developments around `pygame-ce`.

The project is based on React using Next.js, and builds upon the work done in the [pyga.me](https://github.com/pygame-community/pyga.me) repository. A separate Python REST-API will be used for managing user accounts, user submissions and other information to publish on the site.

The project will be initially developed and funded by me, but will transition to a donation-based, open-source project that anyone will be free to contribute to.

Stay tuned for any interesting developments! More updates will be added here and on the [project page on Github](https://github.com/pygame-community/pygame.community).

{end-project}
